api/CliTester.Tools.FixtureRunner.html.keywords: Class FixtureRunner Fixture runner class to start test fixtures Inheritance object FixtureRunner Namespace: CliTester.Tools Assembly: CliTester.dll Syntax public static class FixtureRunner Methods | Edit this page View Source RunConditionalTest<TValue>(FixtureConditional?, out Exception?, params object?[]?) Runs the test fixture for functions that don't return void and compares against the returned value Declaration public static bool RunConditionalTest<TValue>(FixtureConditional? fixture, out Exception? ex, params object?[]? args) Parameters Type Name Description FixtureConditional fixture Test fixture to test against. It must be of type FixtureConditional Exception ex Output parameter for any possible exception being thrown, only populated if the test succeeded object[] args List of arguments Returns Type Description bool true if test has succeeded and the two values match; false otherwise Type Parameters Name Description TValue Value type that must match the expected type value Exceptions Type Condition ArgumentNullException There is no fixture ArgumentException Attempted to pass fixture as base fixture ValueMismatchException Returned value doesn't match expected value | Edit this page View Source RunGeneralTest(Fixture?, out Exception?, params object?[]?) Runs the general-purpose test fixture Declaration public static bool RunGeneralTest(Fixture? fixture, out Exception? ex, params object?[]? args) Parameters Type Name Description Fixture fixture Test fixture to test against. It must not be of type Fixture, but one of its derivatives Exception ex Output parameter for any possible exception being thrown, only populated if the test succeeded object[] args List of arguments Returns Type Description bool true if test has succeeded and the two values match; false otherwise Exceptions Type Condition ArgumentNullException There is no fixture ArgumentException Attempted to pass fixture as base fixture ValueMismatchException Returned value doesn't match expected value | Edit this page View Source RunTest<TDelegate>(FixtureUnconditional<TDelegate>?, out Exception?, params object?[]?) Runs the test fixture for functions that return void Declaration public static bool RunTest<TDelegate>(FixtureUnconditional<TDelegate>? fixture, out Exception? ex, params object?[]? args) where TDelegate : Delegate Parameters Type Name Description FixtureUnconditional<TDelegate> fixture Test fixture to test against. Runs the test fixture for functions that don't return void and compares against the returned value Declaration public static bool RunTest<TDelegate, TValue>(FixtureConditional<TDelegate>? fixture, out Exception? ex, params object?[]? args) where TDelegate : Delegate Parameters Type Name Description FixtureConditional<TDelegate> fixture Test fixture to test against. It must be of type FixtureConditional<TDelegate> Exception ex Output parameter for any possible exception being thrown, only populated if the test succeeded object[] args List of arguments Returns Type Description bool true if test has succeeded and the two values match; false otherwise Type Parameters Name Description TDelegate Delegate type that points to functions that don't return void, such as Func<TResult> delegates TValue Value type that must match the expected type value Exceptions Type Condition ArgumentNullException There is no fixture ArgumentException Attempted to pass fixture as base fixture ValueMismatchException Returned value doesn't match expected value | Edit this page View Source RunUnconditionalTest(FixtureUnconditional?, out Exception?, params object?[]?) index.html.title: | CliTester API - Aptivi
index.html.keywords: What is CliTester? CliTester is a library that allows you to make your tests more interactive. What is this web page? This webpage is an API documentation for mod developers to be used as reference. It constantly gets updated as we push the updates to the main and servicing versions of this project. If you still intend to use a documentation specific to your preferred version of CliTester, you may refer to the releases page of the project and download the attached <version>-doc.zip file. To get started using the documentation, select API Documentation from the top menu and select a namespace to get a clear overview of the API. Feedback If you wish to leave feedback to us about this API reference website, use the issue tracker of the project. If you wish to contribute to the documentation of the API, go to the project source code and make your improvements there on a draft Pull Request; we don't support override files that are made by clicking on Improve this doc. Any meaningful contributions are welcome. Copyright (c) 2024 Aptivi. All rights reserved.
